get.description: Returns a simple health check response.
Returns a list of all users
Returns a list of all groups
Returns a list of all permissions

List all available content types in the system.
Content types represent the models available in the Django application.
This endpoint is restricted to staff users only as it's primarily used for administrative purposes.

post.description: Creates a file with or without post associations.

get.description:
Find files that exist in storage but not in the database.
If a file exists in both public and private storage, it will be considered public.
Returns detailed metadata about each orphaned file.
Gets all the details of a file.

put.description: Updates a file, namely the posts associated with the file. File properties are immutable.

delete.description: Deletes a file from the database and S3.

get.description: List all comments for a post
Gets all the details of a comment.

UserSelf.description: Specifies fields that users can see about themselves
UserSelf.title: UserSelf

UpdateAccount.description: Specifies fields that users can provide to update their account
UpdateAccount.title: UpdateAccount

NewAccount.description: Specifies fields that users can provide to create an account
NewAccount.title: NewAccount

AdminUserDetails.description: Specifies fields that admins can see
AdminUserDetails.title: AdminUserDetails

AdminUserModify.description: Specifies fields that admins can change
AdminUserModify.title: AdminUserModify

GroupMutate.description: Schema for creating and updating groups
GroupMutate.title: GroupMutate

PermissionMutate.description: Schema for creating and updating permissions
PermissionMutate.title: PermissionMutate

mime_type.description: The MIME type of the attachment
mime_type.title: Mime Type

size_in_bytes.description: The size of the attachment in bytes
size_in_bytes.title: Size In Bytes

duration_in_seconds.description: The duration of the attachment in seconds, if it's audio or video
duration_in_seconds.title: Duration In Seconds

url.description: The URL of a site owned by the author. It could be a blog, micro-blog, Twitter account, etc.
url.title: Url

avatar.description: The URL for an image for the author. Should be square and relatively large — such as 512 x 512 pixels.
avatar.title: Avatar

id.description: Unique for that item for that feed over time. If an item is ever updated, the id should be unchanged. New items should never use a previously-used id.
id.title: Id

url.description: The URL of the resource described by the item. It's the permalink.
url.title: Url

external_url.description: The URL of a page elsewhere. This is especially useful for linkblogs.
external_url.title: External Url

title.description: Plain text title of the item. Microblog items in particular may omit titles.
title.title: Title

content_html.description: The HTML content of the item. If content_html includes any HTML, it MUST be encoded as valid HTML.
content_html.title: Content Html

content_text.description: The plain text content of the item. Microblog items in particular may omit titles.
content_text.title: Content Text

summary.description: A plain text sentence or two describing the item. This might be presented in a timeline, for instance.
summary.title: Summary

image.description: The URL of the main image for the item. This image may also appear in the content_html.
image.title: Image

banner_image.description: The URL of an image to use as a banner. Some feed readers may choose to display this banner image at the top of the feed.
banner_image.title: Banner Image

date_published.description: The date the item was published in RFC 3339 format.
date_published.title: Date Published

date_modified.description: The date the item was modified in RFC 3339 format.
date_modified.title: Date Modified

tags.description: An array of tags or categories. These can be used to categorize items across feeds.
tags.title: Tags

language.description: The primary language for the item in the format specified in RFC 5646.
language.title: Language

attachments.description: An array of attachments, such as audio or video files.
attachments.title: Attachments

example.description: The latest posts from my blog
example.title: My Blog Feed

version.description: The URL of the version of the format the feed uses. Must be https://jsonfeed.org/version/1.1
version.title: Version

title.description: The name of the feed, which will often correspond to the name of the website.
title.title: Title

home_page_url.description: The URL of the resource that the feed describes. This should be an HTML page that corresponds to the feed.
home_page_url.title: Home Page Url

feed_url.description: The URL of the feed, and serves as the unique identifier for the feed.
feed_url.title: Feed Url

description.description: Provides more detail, beyond the title, on what the feed is about.
description.title: Description

user_comment.description: A description of the purpose of the feed. This is for the use of people looking at the raw JSON, and should be ignored by feed readers.
user_comment.title: User Comment

next_url.description: The URL of a feed that provides the next n items, where n is determined by the publisher.
next_url.title: Next Url

icon.description: The URL of an image for the feed suitable to be used in a timeline, much the way an avatar might be used. Should be square and relatively large — such as 512 x 512 pixels.
icon.title: Icon

favicon.description: The URL of an image for the feed suitable to be used in a source list. Should be square and relatively small, but not smaller than 64 x 64 pixels.
favicon.title: Favicon

language.description: The primary language for the feed in the format specified in RFC 5646.
language.title: Language

expired.description: Says whether or not the feed is finished — that is, whether or not it will ever update again.
expired.title: Expired

hubs.description: Endpoints that can be used to subscribe to real-time notifications from the publisher of this feed.
hubs.title: Hubs

items.description: An array of items, in reverse-chronological order (newest first).
items.title: Items
